metadata.title: CVE-2016-1575 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The overlayfs implementation in the Linux kernel through 4.5.2 does notproperly maintain POSIX ACL xattr data, which allows local users to gainprivileges by leveraging a group-writable setgid directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1575` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-79-generic - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-79-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-3.13.0-79-lowlatency - 3.13.0-79.123

linux-image-3.13.0-79-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-79.123

linux-image-3.13.0-79-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-79.123
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-79-generic - 3.13.0-79.123
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-79.123').

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
